title: Fairly heavy showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Department of Meteorology says showers or thunder showers will occur at times in Uva and Southern provinces and in Ampara, Batticaloa, Matale and Nuwara-Eliya districts.

title: Trump ends Biden’s hold on sending 2,000-pound bombs to Israel
byline: President Donald Trump has ended his predecessor’s hold on sending 2,000-pound bombs to Israel, lifting a pressure point that had been meant to reduce civilian casualties during the U.S. ally’s war with Hamas in Gaza that is now halted by a tenuous ceasefire.

title: Over 92,000 people affected by bad weather across Sri Lanka
byline: A total of 92,471 people from 27,751 families have been affected by the adverse weather conditions prevailing since January 13, according to the Disaster Management Center (DMC).

title: Customs seizes illegally imported cigarettes worth Rs. 31.5mln
byline: A large consignment of illegally imported cigarettes has been seized by officers of the Sri Lanka Customs Revenue Task Force (RTF) during a special inspection at a warehouse in the Colombo Port premises.

title: At least 29 injured in three-bus collision at Imaduwa
byline: A collision involving three buses at Angulugaha Junction in Imaduwa, Galle, has left at least 29 passengers injured and hospitalized.

title: 73-year-old killed in assault at Mediation Board hearing in Thihagoda
byline: A 73-year-old man has died following an assault that occurred during a mediation board hearing at Pethangahawatta Viharaya in Thihagoda yesterday (25), police reported.

title: No interference in legal process: President AKD promises fair investigations
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake emphasized that the government will not exert any influence on law enforcement agencies, including the police, in the investigation, arrest, and prosecution of individuals involved in fraud and corruption cases.

title: ‘Eagle’s Viewpoint’ in Shanthipura opens to tourists
byline: The Sri Lanka Air Force (SLAF) has announced that the ‘Eagle’s Viewpoint’, located in Shanthipura in Nuwara Eliya District, the village with the highest elevation in Sri Lanka, has been opened to tourists.

title: 33 Indian fishermen arrested for poaching in Sri Lankan waters
byline: A special operation conducted by the Sri Lanka Navy has resulted in the seizure of three Indian fishing boats and the apprehension of 33 Indian fishermen for poaching in Sri Lankan waters.

title: Consumer Affairs Authority conducts over 24,000 raids in 2024
byline: The Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA) carried out a total of 24,761 raids in 2024, leading to 23,953 legal cases being filed against violators.

title: Advisory issued for strong winds and rough seas
byline: The Department of Meteorology has issued an ‘Amber’ advisory for the sea areas off extending from g from Colombo to Mannar via Puttalam and from Matara to Pottuvil via Hambantota.

title: Paddy collectors and Rice Millers must register with govt, submit weekly reports - President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has announced that the government has allocated Rs. 5000 million for the purchase of paddy, marking the highest allocation made by any government in recent times for this purpose.

title: SriLankan Airlines to remain state-owned - Minister confirms
byline: Minister of Transport, Highways, Ports, and Civil Aviation, Bimal Rathnayake, has affirmed that necessary steps are being taken to ensure the continued operation of SriLankan Airlines as a state-owned company.

title: Kamindu Mendis crowned ICC Men’s Emerging Cricketer of the Year
byline: Kamindu Mendis, who shone for Sri Lanka with consistent batting displays in the year gone by, has been named as the ICC Men’s Emerging Cricketer of the Year.

title: Govt. to introduce insurance scheme for fishermen
byline: Deputy Minister of Fisheries, Rathna Gamage, says that steps will be taken to introduce an insurance scheme for fishermen.

title: 34 Indian fishermen arrested for poaching in Sri Lankan waters
byline: A special operation conducted by the Sri Lanka Navy has resulted in the seizure of three Indian fishing boats and the apprehension of 34 Indian fishermen for poaching in Sri Lankan waters.

title: President assures fair and equitable basic salary increase for public sector
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has emphasized that the government is taking steps to strengthen the public service as a right of the citizen and a responsibility of public officials.

title: Major reservoirs still spilling due to heavy rains
byline: The Department of Irrigation states that 46 out of the 73 major reservoirs under its management are still continuing to spill water due to the heavy rains experienced across the island.

title: 4 inmates injured in clash at Galle Prison; STF deployed
byline: At least four inmates of the Galle Prison have been injured and hospitalized following a clash this afternoon.

title: Train derails near Omanthai railway station
byline: An intercity express train traveling from Jaffna to Colombo Fort has derailed near the Omanthai railway station.

title: South Korea President Yoon indicted for insurrection over martial law decree
byline: South Korea’s prosecutors indicted impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol on Sunday on charges of leading an insurrection with his short-lived imposition of martial law on Dec. 3, Yoon’s lawyers and the main opposition party said.
